intro: Lavoisiera alba, commonly known as the white lavoisiera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its delicate white flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. Native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it contributes to the biodiversity of these habitats. Its botanical features make it a valuable subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
